description.narrative: By 2022, capacities have been developed in sectoral ministries in the social priority area to provide an intersectoral approach, with effective strategies to combat malnutrition in all its forms in priority areas., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, mothers, children, adolescents and families, especially the most vulnerable (on the northern border, indigenous peoples, Afrodescendants and others) and/or in emergency situations, exercise their right to health, education, water and sanitation and to informed and effective participation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, capacities have been developed in sectoral ministries in the social priority area to provide an intersectoral approach, with effective strategies to combat malnutrition in all its forms in priority areas.

description.narrative: Ecuador's CO works towards the reduction of all forms of malnutrition (undernutrition and overweight and obesity) through a life-cycle approach at community, institutional and structural levels. The CO supports the development of culturally appropriate intersectoral models that promote healthy habits and that ensure effective preventative responses to undernutrition. Along this, the CO also strives to strengthen policies that regulate the food industry and support healthier environments for children. In this way, UNICEF CO supports the government in its efforts to reduce national rates of stunting, anemia and overweight and obesity. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2020

target.value: 2022:4,500 Mass media reached with key messages: 1,000,000 people

baseline.value: Current initiatives with little proven effectiveness

target.value: 2022:Three Municipalities successfully implement an intersectorial health and nutrition strategies aimed at reducing malnutrition

actual.value: 2019:One municipality with an active intersectoral working group and 7 active intersectoral working groups in 7 parishes
